intro: Maesa cambodiana, commonly known as the Cambodian maesa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
